Inside the Black Fortress:

On a lower level, down where the recharge cham=
bers are positioned
Cyclonus, Scourge and the others slept, in blissful ign=
orance of the
events transpiring around the base. 

However for a few of th=
em, appearances were deceptive. 

For Cyclonus and Scourge they fought a wa=
r, not one of armor and steel
but of programming and free will. The shell p=
rogramming that held
their loyalty to Unicron was disintegrating, but the b=
reak down was
not pretty. 

Inside them Shell program raged as slowly lost =
its hold it had on
them. Slowly though things began to settle as Cyclonus a=
nd Scourge
began to assert their own will, for perhaps the first time in de=
cades,
if not their lives. 

"FOOLISH!" The voice of Unicron echoed inside =
Cyclonus and Scourge's
head. "You have escaped me for only a moment! You wi=
ll never fail to
elude me completely!"

"I am NO ONE'S LACKY!" Cyclonus' vo=
ice spoke, firm as steel! 

"Ahhh, Cyclonus. That is where you are wrong." =
Unicron's voice spoke
softly, "You have the greatest potential of all my cr=
eations, perhaps
even more then Galvatron or Vorpal, but you will always ha=
ve this
final flaw, it is as the core of your very being, inextricably part=
 of
your construction: You need to follow!"

"NO!" Cyclonus barked, his voi=
ce suddenly horse. 

"Yes!" Unicron's voice cackled gleefully. "I will see =
you again. And
you will fall under MY WILL ONCE MORE!"

Cyclonus just shook=
 his head back and forth as he shut his eyes.
Scourge glared at Unicron bef=
ore his world also went dark. 

****************************************

B=
ack in the real world, in the recharge pods Cyclonus and Scourge's
optics f=
lickered and returned to life! 

With explosive power both pods burst apart=
 as Cyclonus and Scourge
step out and looked around. "Where are we?" Cyclon=
us rasped as he
looked around. 

"I smell Predacons." Scourge said as he to=
o glanced around, his weapon
drawn and ready. "They never smelled quite rig=
ht! Decepticons had a
better feel to them."

Cyclonus nods, "Come, let us s=
ee who dares hold us! Yes, they have
much to explain!"

Cyclonus looked ove=
r at the main door to the room they were in. With a
simple gesture and just=
 a touch of power it exploded off its hinges,
flying against the far wall. =


With a slight nod Cyclonus stepped out of the room and began to walk,
Sco=
urge following behind him like a shadow!

*********************************=
*

As Cyclonus stepped out of the room, and the smoke began to settle,
anot=
her chamber occupant came to life for a moment: Dark Rodimus. For
a moment =
his optics brightened as he watched the carnage. A smile
whispered across h=
is face and then faded as he dropped back into
blissful sleep and his syste=
ms continued to repair themselves.
